github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text:
Use conventional commit message format with EventRunner 6 specific guidelines:

FORMAT:
- Subject line: <type>: <description>
- Blank line after subject
- Body: Additional tagged changes (one per line)

TYPES:
- feat: New features or functionality
- fix: Bug fixes or corrections
- docs: Documentation changes
- refactor: Code restructuring without behavior changes
- test: Adding or updating tests

MULTI-TAG COMMITS:
For commits with multiple types of changes, use body lines:

Subject: feat: implement sensor dashboard
[BLANK LINE]
fix: correct temperature conversion bug
docs: add sensor configuration guide
test: add sensor validation tests

EXAMPLES:
Single change:
feat: add new device support for Z-Wave sensors

Multiple changes:
feat: enhance rule engine performance

fix: resolve memory leak in event processing
docs: update installation guide
test: add integration tests for MQTT

IMPORTANT:
- Use lowercase prefixes
- Include colon and space after type
- Keep descriptions clear and concise
- Always add blank line before body content
- Each body line should be a separate tagged change
